paragraphs: Each semester, UDâ€™s Center for Cybersecurity and Data Intelligence (CCDI) invites UD faculty and scholars from a variety of disciplines to share their expertise on diverse cybersecurity topics. These seminars are open to all UD faculty, staff and graduate students.

Lunch is provided, but we encourage attendees to bring a beverage of their choice. The CCDI Seminar Series is supported with funding from the Ohio Cyber Range Institute (OCRI) and the Ohio Department of Higher Education.

modules.title: Fall 2023 CCDI Seminars
modules.description: Come learn about a variety of cybersecurity topics from UD faculty and scholars. Topics are presented in a way that colleagues from diverse disciplines can participate and learn - all are welcome!
modules.imagealt: Interior of the Team Penske race shop viewed from above.
introContents: Each session includes two 40-minute presentations starting at 12:20 p.m. and 1:00 p.m. - come for one or both. Lunch is provided starting at 12:00 p.m.; bring your own beverage.

• IT Security @ UD - Dean Halter (UDit)
  • Dayton Regional Cyber Range @ UD - John Wolfe (CCDI)

• Online Romance Scams - James Robinson (COM)
  • Planning for Pursuit-Evasion Under Uncertainty - Nick Stiffler (CPS)

• My Evolutionary Path of ML/AI in Sustainable Energy Research- Kevin Hallinan (MEE)
  • Human Pose Detection for VR Interactivities - Ju Shen (CPS)
